text: Hey, does someone know which field is used by HubSpot for a company to avoid duplicate ?
Hi <@U01DF3PNCKA> - the default field is ‘Company Name’.
seems it’s not Company name i can add multiple time a company with same name
Ideally it should give a warning when creating multiple companies using the same name.

it does not, found this i the doc
`*Please note:* companies created through API will not be deduplicated by the _Company domain name_ property.`
Why are they doing that it make no sense
How to make images lazy load in HubSpot

Typing practice for developers:
<https://typing.io/lessons>

In your custom modules where images are used and are not critical that they load immediately with the page, add `loading="lazy"`. We are working on building support for native lazy loading in ways that give both developers and marketers control. Stay tuned.
<@U01DF3PNCKA> you probably want to take a look at this page: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/crm-setup/deduplication-of-contacts-companies-deals-tickets>
Yep but it’s not the case when you use api, i made a test, and it’s write on the documentation, api insert don’t take care about duplication
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/API-Primary-key-check-when-insert-company/idi-p/380486> all information about the issue and the actual behaviour are on my post
That is exactly what the documentation says, that's why I pointed you at it.
Yes i already see it, that’s what i open an issue (link i send you), the expected behaviour is that we have the same functionality when importing with api as importing with built in import system

The "expected behavior" would be what's in the documentation.  I think you're describing the behavior that you'd like, but it's not necessarily what everyone would want.  I added a comment to your community post explaining some of the reasons why I wouldn't want the API to do this.
Hi! Is there a preferred channel for questions about the chat widget/conversations sdk?
<#C019VT42R8X|workflows>
seems the right one
thanks, ill try that!
It’s the behaviour of the standard in api building

it’s the behaviour of HubSpot app to use domain as primary key , so it’s the expected behaviour to have iso behaviour between app and api, their is not debate possible on this, it’s juste the logical way and the way any standard api works
By the way my post is not about which key HubSpot app should use but it’s on adding on API , like in contact a duplicate check
Wow, OK.  Bye.
